item.title: graham add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: graham add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: graham add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "How many legs does a dog have if you call the tail a leg? Four. Calling a tail a leg doesn't make it a leg." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: graham add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "Cultural legacies are powerful forces. They have deep roots and long lives. They persist, generation after generation, virtually intact, even as the economic and social and demographic conditions that spawned them have vanished, and they play such a role in directing attitudes and behavior that we cannot make sense of our world without them." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: graham add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Once there was a tree, and she loved a little boy." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: graham add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Somebody has to go polish the stars, They're looking a little bit dull. Somebody has to go polish the stars, For the eagles and starlings and gulls Have all been complaining they're tarnished and worn, They say they want new ones we cannot afford. So please get your rags And your polishing jars, Somebody has to go polish the stars." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: graham add a quote by Henrik Ibsen
item.description: "A thousand words leave not the same deep impression as does a single deed." -- Henrik Ibsen

item.title: graham add a quote by Henrik Ibsen
item.description: "The majority is never right. Never, I tell you! That's one of these lies in society that no free and intelligent man can help rebelling against. Who are the people that make up the biggest proportion of the population -- the intelligent ones or the fools?" -- Henrik Ibsen

item.title: graham add a quote by George RR Martin
item.description: "The great thing about reading is that it broadens your life" -- George RR Martin

item.title: graham add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: graham add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: graham add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description:
"And as I sat there brooding on the old, unknown world, I thought of Gatsby’s wonder when he first picked out the green light at the end of Daisy’s dock. He had come a long way to this blue lawn, and his dream must have seemed so close that he could hardly fail to grasp it. He did not know that it was already behind him, somewhere back in that vast obscurity beyond the city, where the dark fields of the republic rolled on under the night.
Gatsby believed in the green light, the orgastic future that year by year recedes before us. It eluded us then, but that's no matter—to-morrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther. . . . And one fine morning——
So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: graham add a quote by Genghis Khan
item.description: "I am the punishment of God...If you had not committed great sins, God would not have sent a punishment like me upon you." -- Genghis Khan
